text: Former Liberal MP Christopher Pyne says “it’s good for us to debate freedom of the press and whether we’ve achieved the right balance,” because “journalists are being put under the microscope”. Mr Pyne told Sky News he was “not a commentator on current or previous government policies anymore,” but Australia “always had a stricter approach than a lot of other western nations around the world to press freedom". "But that’s what democracy is all about," he said. “In Australia we’ve always had a high level of trust for government, we don’t have the big brother approach that some governments have had over the years."
